t: Deuteronomy 33
Moses’s Blessings
This*p is the blessing that Moses, the man of God, gave the Israelites before his death.
He said: The*pn Lord*s came from Sinai and*ln appeared to them from Seir; he*ln shone on them from Mount Paran and*ln came with ten thousand holy ones, with*ln lightning from his right hand for them.
Indeed*ln he loves the people. All*ln your holy ones are in your hand, and*ln they assemble at your feet. Each*ln receives your words.
Moses*ln gave us instruction, a*ln possession for the assembly of Jacob.
So*ln he became King in Jeshurun when*ln the leaders of the people gathered with*ln the tribes of Israel.
Let*pn Reuben live and not die though*ln his people become few.
He*p said this about Judah: Lord,*spn hear Judah’s cry and bring him to his people. He*ln fights for his cause with his own hands, but*ln may you be a help against his foes.
He*p said about Levi: Your*pn Thummim and Urim belong to your faithful one; you*ln tested him at Massah and*ln contended with him at the Waters of Meribah.
He*ln said about his father and mother, “I*ln do not regard them.” He*ln disregarded his brothers and*ln didn’t acknowledge his sons, for*ln they kept your word and*ln maintained your covenant.
They*ln will teach your ordinances to Jacob and*ln your instruction to Israel; they*ln will set incense before you and*ln whole burnt offerings on your altar.
Lord,*sln bless his possessions, and*ln accept the work of his hands. Break*ln the back of his adversaries and enemies, so*ln that they cannot rise again.
He*p said about Benjamin: The*pn Lord’s*s beloved rests securely on him. He*ln shields him all day long, and*ln he rests on his shoulders.
He*p said about Joseph: May*pn his land be blessed by the Lord*s with*ln the dew of heaven’s bounty and*ln the watery depths that lie beneath;
with*ln the bountiful harvest from the sun and*ln the abundant yield of the seasons;
with*ln the best products of the ancient mountains and*ln the bounty of the eternal hills;

with*ln the choice gifts of the land and*ln everything in it; and*ln with the favor of him who*ln appeared in the burning bush. May*ln these rest on the head of Joseph, on*ln the brow of the prince of his brothers.

His*ln firstborn bull has splendor, and*ln horns like those of a wild ox; he*ln gores all the peoples with them to*ln the ends of the earth. Such*ln are the ten thousands of Ephraim, and*ln such are the thousands of Manasseh.
He*p said about Zebulun: Rejoice,*pn Zebulun, in your journeys, and*ln Issachar, in your tents.
They*ln summon the peoples to a mountain; there*ln they offer acceptable sacrifices. For*ln they draw from the wealth of the seas and*ln the hidden treasures of the sand.
He*p said about Gad: The*pn one who enlarges Gad’s territory will*ln be blessed. He*ln lies down like a lion and*ln tears off an arm or even a head.

He*ln chose the best part for himself, because*ln a ruler’s portion was assigned there for him. He*ln came with the leaders of the people; he*ln carried out the Lord’s*s justice and*ln his ordinances for Israel.
He*p said about Dan: Dan*pn is a young lion, leaping*ln out of Bashan.
He*p said about Naphtali: Naphtali,*pn enjoying approval, full*ln of the Lord’s*s blessing, take*ln possession to the west and the south.
He*p said about Asher: May*pn Asher be the most blessed of the sons; may*ln he be the most favored among his brothers and*ln dip his foot in olive oil.
May*ln the bolts of your gate be iron and bronze, and*ln your strength last as long as you live.
There*pn is none like the God of Jeshurun, who*ln rides the heavens to your aid, the*ln clouds in his majesty.
The*ln God of old is your dwelling place, and*ln underneath are the everlasting arms. He*ln drives out the enemy before you and*ln commands, “Destroy!”
So*ln Israel dwells securely; Jacob*ln lives untroubled in*ln a land of grain and new wine; even*ln his skies drip with dew.

How*ln happy you are, Israel! Who*ln is like you, a*ln people saved by the Lord?*s He*ln is the shield that protects you, the*ln sword you boast in. Your*ln enemies will cringe before you, and*ln you will tread on their backs.
